ToggleButton.title: Combined mode
ToggleButton.tip: All the actions accesible using differnt mouse buttons
ToggleButton.info: The effect of clicking or dragging is determined by which mouse button is used and how the mouse is moved. -p- To zoom in, click with the left button. -p- To zoom out, click with the right button. -p- To pan, press and drag with the right button. -p- For a box cursor, press the left button at one desired corner, drag up and to the left a little way, then drag back past the starting point. The cursor will appeaar as you recross the starting point.

Checkbox.title: Smoothing
Checkbox.label: smooth
Checkbox.info: When this is not selected, lines and borders are drawn by filling in complete pixels only. So, for a black line on a white background all pixels are either black or white. -p- With smoothing ("antialiasing") on, where the line half crosses a pixel the pixel will be filled in a shade of gray. This makes lines and edges look smoother. -p- But it taks the system longer to calculate the shaded pixels and can make the image slow to update. It is most responsive with smoothing switched off.

Checkbox.title: Labels
Checkbox.label: labels
Checkbox.tip: turn labels on or off on the diagram
Checkbox.info: Labels are handy if you don't know what things are, but can get in the way at other times.

Button.title: Reframe
Button.tip: reset the ranges so all the data is visible
Button.info: Resets the ranges of the display so that all the data is visible.
